description: Shortened from gooney, from obsolete gony ("simpleton", circa 1580), of unknown origin. Perhaps a familiar term derived from Middle English gone, a variant of gome (“man, person”). Gony was applied by sailors to the albatross and similar big, clumsy birds (circa 1839). Goon first carried the meaning "stupid person" (circa 1921).

entries.meaning: A thug; a usually muscular henchman with little intelligence.
A fool; someone who is silly, stupid, awkward, or outlandish.
(ice hockey, derogatory)  An enforcer or fighter.
(UK, World War II, PoW slang) A German guard in a prisoner-of-war camp.
(slang) One hired to legally kidnap a child and forcibly transport them to a boot camp, boarding school, wilderness therapy, or a similar rehabilitation facility.
(Internet slang) A member of the comedy web site Something Awful.

verbs.description: goon (third-person singular simple present goons, present participle gooning, simple past and past participle gooned)

entries.meaning: (transitive, slang, chiefly ice hockey) To act like a goon; to act in an intimidating or aggressive way towards opponents.
(neologism) To legally kidnap a child and forcibly transport them to a boot camp, boarding school, wilderness therapy, or a similar rehabilitation facility.

description: Perhaps diminutive slang for flagon or from Aboriginal English goom.

entries.meaning: (Australia, countable, informal) A wine flagon or cask.
examples: We drank goons of cheap wine.

entries.meaning: (Australia, uncountable, informal) Cheap or inferior cask wine.
examples: ‘On the night of our school graduation he stole a flagon of goon wine and disappeared into the woods. The police found him the next day asleep on the creek. […] ’

entries.meaning: A Sino-Japanese kanji pronunciation layer, considered the first Sino-Japanese kanji reading type imported into Japan.
examples: The term 語法 is read as 'gohou', using the kanji's goon readings.

verbs.description: goon (third-person singular simple present goons, present participle gooning, simple past and past participle gooned)

entries.meaning: (Internet slang) To enter a trance-like state after masturbating and edging for a long period of time.
